==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|type=211111}}

===Etymology===
* A quote from [[w:Zhuangzi|Zhuangzi]]
: Literally: The friendship between men of virtue is clear like water (no flavor, but free of harmful substances -- i.e. self-interest. In contrast, the friendship between lesser men is sweet like wine, but lacks true substance).

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=jūnzǐ zhī jiāo dàn rú shuǐ
|cat=prov
}}

===Proverb===
{{zh-proverb}}

# True friendship between two men of accomplishment need not be overly demonstrative.
